{"step_by_step_thinking": "Model plaster, also known as Plaster of Paris, is used in the medical field for casting. The main component of Plaster of Paris is a form of calcium sulfate. The difference between the two options C and D is the amount of water molecules attached to the calcium sulfate. Plaster of Paris is a hemihydrate of calcium sulfate, meaning it has half a molecule of water for each molecule of calcium sulfate.", "answer_choice": "C"}
